data.sentence: The word أُولَئِكَ comes from the root ا و ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word فِيهَا comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.

data.meanings: to bind, be patient or constant, endure patiently, steadily adhere to reason and command, restrain from what reason and law forbid, restrain from manifesting grief, agitation and impatience. The word being the contrary of jaz'a (manifestation of grief and agitation).. . Sabar (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He bore with patience.. Sabaruu (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They bore patiently, patiently preserved.. Sabartum (prf. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You patiently preserved.. Sabarnaa (imp. 1st. p.m. plu.): We patiently preserved.. Yasbir (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing. fuss.): He patiently preserves.. Tasbiru (imp. 2nd. p.m. sing. fuss.): You have patience.. Tasbiruuna/Tasbiruu (acc. /imp. 2nd. p.m. plu. juss.): You will patiently preserve.. . Nasbira imp. neg. 1st. p. plu. ): We will not at all remain content.. Nasbiranna (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We will surely endure patiently.. Isbir (prt. m. sing.): Preserve thou (in doing good); Bear patiently; Wait thou patiently.. Isbiruu (prt. in. plu.): Be patiently preserving.. Saabiruu (prt. m. plu. III): Strive to excel in being patiently preserving.. Istabir (prt. in. plu. sing.): Be steadfast.. Sabrun/Sabran (acc./ v. n.): Patience.. Saabiruun/ Saabiriin (acc. /act. pic. plu.): Those who are calm and steadfast.. Saabiratun (act. plc. f sing.): Preserving one f.. Saabiraat (act. plc. f. plu.): Preserving women.. Asbara (elative.) : How very enduring.. Sabaar (ints. sing.): Patiently preserving.. Saabiran (act. pic. m. sing. acc.): Patient.
data.sentence: The word صَبَرُوا comes from the root ص ب ر and is associated with the meanings: to bind, be patient or constant, endure patiently, steadily adhere to reason and command, restrain from what reason and law forbid, restrain from manifesting grief, agitation and impatience. The word being the contrary of jaz'a (manifestation of grief and agitation).. . Sabar (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He bore with patience.. Sabaruu (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They bore patiently, patiently preserved.. Sabartum (prf. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You patiently preserved.. Sabarnaa (imp. 1st. p.m. plu.): We patiently preserved.. Yasbir (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing. fuss.): He patiently preserves.. Tasbiru (imp. 2nd. p.m. sing. fuss.): You have patience.. Tasbiruuna/Tasbiruu (acc. /imp. 2nd. p.m. plu. juss.): You will patiently preserve.. . Nasbira imp. neg. 1st. p. plu. ): We will not at all remain content.. Nasbiranna (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We will surely endure patiently.. Isbir (prt. m. sing.): Preserve thou (in doing good); Bear patiently; Wait thou patiently.. Isbiruu (prt. in. plu.): Be patiently preserving.. Saabiruu (prt. m. plu. III): Strive to excel in being patiently preserving.. Istabir (prt. in. plu. sing.): Be steadfast.. Sabrun/Sabran (acc./ v. n.): Patience.. Saabiruun/ Saabiriin (acc. /act. pic. plu.): Those who are calm and steadfast.. Saabiratun (act. plc. f sing.): Preserving one f.. Saabiraat (act. plc. f. plu.): Preserving women.. Asbara (elative.) : How very enduring.. Sabaar (ints. sing.): Patiently preserving.. Saabiran (act. pic. m. sing. acc.): Patient.

data.meanings: Pay/give/render a satisfaction, make sufficient, pay a debt, to contend, repay/requit/compensate, to recompense.
data.sentence: The word يُجْزَوْنَ comes from the root ج ز ي and is associated with the meanings: Pay/give/render a satisfaction, make sufficient, pay a debt, to contend, repay/requit/compensate, to recompense.

data.meanings: safety/security/freedom/immunity, to escape, salutation/greeting/peace, deliver/acknowledge, pay in advance, submit, sincerity, humility, submission/conformance/obedience, resign/quit/relinquish, to be in sound condition, well without blemish, gentle/tender/soft/elegant. Solomon/Sulaiman.
data.sentence: The word وَسَلَامًا comes from the root س ل م and is associated with the meanings: safety/security/freedom/immunity, to escape, salutation/greeting/peace, deliver/acknowledge, pay in advance, submit, sincerity, humility, submission/conformance/obedience, resign/quit/relinquish, to be in sound condition, well without blemish, gentle/tender/soft/elegant. Solomon/Sulaiman.

data.meanings: (a doubly imperfect verb) To live, be alive, be ashamed, spend (the night) awake, fertilize the earth, keep anyone alive; spare any one, let anyone alive, remove prudency, modesty and shamefulness, make immodest
data.sentence: The word تَحِيَّةً comes from the root ح ي ي and is associated with the meanings: (a doubly imperfect verb) To live, be alive, be ashamed, spend (the night) awake, fertilize the earth, keep anyone alive; spare any one, let anyone alive, remove prudency, modesty and shamefulness, make immodest

data.meanings: took, cut, cut off, clip, bent, broken; a species of trees with which one tans; quantity (of water) that is taken by the hand; chamber in the uppermost story, the highest of the places of Paradise; a certain large measure of capacity; having much water; swift
data.sentence: The word الْغُرْفَةَ comes from the root غ ر ف and is associated with the meanings: took, cut, cut off, clip, bent, broken; a species of trees with which one tans; quantity (of water) that is taken by the hand; chamber in the uppermost story, the highest of the places of Paradise; a certain large measure of capacity; having much water; swift

data.meanings: To meet, meet with, encounter, find, find out a thing, see, come across, experience, suffer from, occur, undergo, endure, lean upon, recieve, come face to face, go in the direction of or towards.This root has occurred in al quran in 45 forms, and been used about 145 times.
data.sentence: The word وَيُلَقَّوْنَ comes from the root ل ق ي and is associated with the meanings: To meet, meet with, encounter, find, find out a thing, see, come across, experience, suffer from, occur, undergo, endure, lean upon, recieve, come face to face, go in the direction of or towards.This root has occurred in al quran in 45 forms, and been used about 145 times.
